content: /=A violent rumble in the ground silences him. His face grows concerned.=/
/=After a few moments of silence, he smiles.=/
[eyvind] "And I want to use your bow to fire an arrow through a line of enemies."
/=Before you settle down to rest, Eyvind beckons to you.=/
/=Eyvind's instructions are easy to follow, but tough to repeat accurately more than twice in a row.=/
/=Eyvind thinks about your question.=/
[eyvind] "Have you memorized the basic threads of mending yet?"
[eyvind] "If you're enjoying learning how to do something, why should you ever stop?"
[eyvind] "In spellweaving, the lack of motion is just as important as the patterned movements."
[eyvind] "Juno!"
[eyvind] "Many people feel there is always something to say or do, but you understand that's false. Good."
[eyvind] "Part of weaving is knowing what pattern you're looking to create before you ever begin."
[eyvind] "Spellweaving is creating, and every creator feels they're not good enough at some point. But you keep trying."
/=The mender nods, but watches you silently.=/

content.option: "Are you going to show me more?"
"Maybe I'm not cut out for mending."

content: /=The mender smiles. =/
[eyvind] "We'll start small. I'll show you a pattern so tiny it will feel like you're doing nothing, but it's the foundation of many great woven spells."
/=You listen attentively as he compares it to music and begins instructing you.=/
[eyvind] "You're getting it, you just need to relax and--"
/=He bolts through the shaking woods faster than you imagined he could move.=/
[$hero] "And how long before you just admit you're no good at it and stop?"
/=His compliment makes you blush.=/
[$hero] "I...think so. It's hard to find time to practice, though. It feels like someone always needs something."
[$hero] "Right. So, I want to mend a wound like you did with Iver's arm."
[$hero] "Yeah, but that took me years to...oh, I get it."
/=It is your turn to think about his response.=/
{skip} mark1=$hero mark2=eyvind
